de.a46.memory.gui
Class MultiImagePanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--de.a46.memory.gui.MPanel
                          |
                          +--de.a46.memory.gui.MultiImagePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class MultiImagePanel
extends MPanel

This grafical class allows to show an unlimited number of images. Also a line of text can be drawn on this MultiImagePanel. In the memory this class is used to show the bigImages on the LeftPanel. Events are casted according to class MPanel.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getImageID

public int getImageID()
returns the current imageID
Returns:
an int as the current image's index in the images array.

setImage

public void setImage(int imageID)
sets the current image by its index in the images array. If the new one is different, a repaint will be done.
Parameters:
imageID - an int identifying the new image in the images array.

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
sets the line of text to a new value. If this is different from the old value, a repaint will be caused.
Parameters:
text - a String containing the text to be drawn. If its value is null, no text will be drawn.

setImages

public void setImages(java.awt.Image[] images)
sets the array of images.
Parameters:
images - the new image array.

getImage

public java.awt.Image getImage()
returns the currently shown image.
Returns:
the image currently shown. If no image shown, null will be returned.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
paints this component. At first the current Image will be drawn, if one is selected. Then the current text, if not null.
Overrides:
paint in class java.awt.Container
